RECORD.TEXT: 669315724 PUMC 5401454 496776 59147 2/26/1997 12:00:00 AM CORONARY ARTERY DISEASE . Unsigned DIS Report Status : Unsigned DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : ELKS , BRENNE L UNIT NUMBER : 324-34-04 ADMISSION DATE : 02/26/97 DISCHARGE DATE : 03/07/97 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : coronary artery disease . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : March 2 , 1997 coronary artery bypass graft surgery x two . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is a fifty nine-year-old female who presented with new onset of substernal chest pain on February 25 , 1997 while climbing the stairs . She also experienced shortness of breath at that time . She was admitted to the hospital and ruled out for a myocardial infarction . She was started on intravenous heparin , nitroglycerin and beta blockers . cardiac catheterization on February 27 , 1997 revealed two vessel disease of the right coronary artery and proximal left anterior descending . There is a left ventricular function . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Depression . status post dilation and curettage . Hypercholesterolemia , status post cholecystectomy . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Paxil , Prempro . ALLERGIES : IVP dye . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : The patient was a pleasant woman in no acute distress , blood pressure 110/70 , heart rate of 55 in sinus rhythm , head and neck examination was without bruit , cardiovascular examination showed a regular heart rate and rhythm without murmur . The lungs were clear . The abdomen was soft , non-tender , nondistended . Extremities were 2+. Pulses throughout without bruits . There were spider veins bilaterally in the legs and thighs . No obvious varicose veins and no previous extremity surgery . LABORATORY : Pre-operative laboratory values ; hematocrit 35.5 , white count 8.6 , partial thromboplastin time 57.2 . electrocardiogram showed normal sinus rhythm with poor R wave progression . chest x-ray showed a slightly elevated left hemidiaphragm , the lungs are clear . HOSPITAL COURSE AND TREATMENT : The patient was cleared by the cardiology service for coronary artery bypass graft surgery . She underwent bypass surgery on March 2 , 1997 with LIMA to the left anterior descending and saphenous vein graft to the right coronary artery . Please see the operative note for details of surgical procedure . In brief , the operative course was uneventful with a total bypass time of fifty-four minutes and cross clamp time of 36 minutes . The patient received one unit of packed cells intra-operatively . She was transferred to the SICU on intravenous infusions of Amicar , Fentanyl and Versed at 8 , Lidocaine at 1 and nitroglycerin at 50 . Post pump the patient was in sinus rhythm , required no pacing . The patient was weaned off ventilatory support and pressors by postoperative day one . She was extubated uneventfully . All tubes and lines were removed for usual protocol , prior to discharge from the Intensive Care Unit . On the floor the patient made a rapid recovery . She was apaced intermittently on the floor for a low heart rate and sinus rhythm . Pericardial pacing wires were removed on postoperative day three . The patient began to ambulate soon thereafter . She was diuresed to her pre-operative weight and began N / N diet prior to discharge . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Enteric coated aspirin 325 milligrams po q day . Tylenol # 3 as needed . Iron sulfate 325 milligrams po q day . Folate 1 milligram po q day . Prior to discharge instructions were given regarding the importance of exercise and nutrition in reduction of further cardiac risk factors . The patient is to follow up with Dr. Dye and Dr. Ralnmav . Appropriate arrangements for these appointments have been made .
